examples:
jan mute a li tawa ni, taso jan pi mute lili li awen. | Almost all people went there.
tenpo poka kama la, ona tu li awen wan lon sike tu wan. | They've been together for almost three years.
lawa mi li ante. | I am autistic.

mi wile moku. | I **am** hungry.
sina o sina. | Just **be** yourself.
mi pilin la mi **lon**. | I think, therefore I **am**.

eng: a large mammal with shaggy fur, a small tail, and flat feet
examples:
mi kama alasa e soweli. | We're going on a bear hunt.
o luka ala e soweli suli. | Don't touch the bear.
lon ma Amelika lete la soweli pimeja li moku e kasi e soweli kin. | In North America, black bears are omnivores.
soweli pimeja walo ni li moku ala e kasi palisa ona tan seme? | Why is the panda not eating its bamboo?
mi pilin monsuta mute tan soweli walo pi ma lete. | I have a fear of polar bears.

eng: Koala bear, a tree-dwelling mammal native to Australia
examples: jan Minsen li jo e luka mi sama soweli lape pi ma Oselija. | Minsin clasped my arm like a koala.

eng: To carry or withstand, literally or figuratively
examples:
jan Santa li jo e ilo musi mute. | Santa bears many presents.
jan lili tu wan li lon insa pi jan mama. | The expecting parent is bearing triplets.
noka ona li awen e linja kipisi pi tenpo ike pakala ona. | Her legs bear the scars of her trauma.

tok: mije suli pi linja sijelo mute
examples: mi mije suli pi linja sijelo mute li wile unpa pi tenpo lili e mije ante mute. | I'm a bear seeking hook-ups.

soweli mi li musi kepeken linja. | My cat plays with string.
kulupu mama mi li jo e soweli tomo tu. | My family has two cats.

jan pi ma Sonko li wile lukin e soweli alasa. | The Chinese person wants to observe a predator cat.
soweli suli li alasa e kulupu pi soweli lili. | The predator cat hunts a group of smaller animals.
mi kepeken ilo kule mute lon musi Manka la, ilo nanpa mi li wile moli pakala | when i use a lot of shader mods in Minecraft, my computer wants to explode
pipi en kala li **sama ala**. | Bugs are **different** from fish.
mi o lape lon tenpo **ante**. | I should go to bed at a **different** time.
toki Sonko li **wile e pali mute**. | Chinese is a **difficult** language.

sina seme? | What are you **doing**?
kon li pona e mi. | The fresh air **did** me some good.
o pali! | **Do** your job!
ona li weka e jaki kepeken telo. mi **ni** kin. | They are washing the floor, and I **do** too.
mi sona **a** e ni. | I **do** know that.

tok: jan, jan sijelo, jan pi pona sijelo
examples: jan ni li pona e insa mi ni: ona li kama e telo tan moku | this is my gastrointestinologist

tok: jan, jan sona, jan pi {field of expertise}
eng: an expert in a field who graduated with a PhD or equivalent
examples: jan pi sona toki li utala mute a | doctors of linguistics very frequently debate
jan **ale** o open e lipu ona. | **Each** person should open their books.

eng: land (as opposed to sky or sea)
examples: jan li lawa e **ma** la sewi li lawa e sewi. | Whereas mortals rule the **Earth**, the divine rules over heaven.
**ko** ni **ma** li pona tawa kasi. | This **earth** is good for agriculture.

eng: the ball produced by a bird
examples: sina pali seme kepeken ko jelo pi **sike waso**? | What did you make with the **egg** yolk?

eng: the ball produced by a parent
examples: seme li kama lon open: mama sike anu **sike mama**? | What came first, the chicken or the **egg**?
a! pimeja li kama suli! mi weka. | ah! it's gotten late! **good night!**
o lape pona, jan lili suwi o | **good night** kiddo

eng: the word that starts the name
examples: **nimi open** pi nimi jan li suli tan seme? | Why is the **headnoun** capitalised?

eng: the main word, the head word
examples: sina kepeken **nimi lawa** seme? | Which **headnoun** do you use?
mi lon! | i'm **here**!
mi kama awen lon ma ni lon sike pini poka | we moved **here** last year
mi jo olin e soweli ni la ona li pilin pona kin. | When I hug my plush toy, they feel nice as well.
jan olin li luka olin e mi li mu suwi. | My partner hugged me and made a cute noise.
ona li **sike e luka** ona lon mi. | They **hug** me with their arms around me.
sina seli e telo **la** ona li weka. | **If** you boil water, it evaporates.
sona nanpa li **pona** tawa mi. | I **like** maths.

eng: enjoy emotionally, feel good about something
examples: mi **pilin pona** tawa sitelen lili ni. | I quite **like** this sticker.
**tenpo mute** la telo li awen li pakala e kiwen nasin. | Water **likes** to collect in puddles and ruin the concrete.
mi ken sona olin **sama** sina. | I could even learn how to love **like** you.

**ken** la mi sitelen nasa e ni. | **Maybe** I wrote this weirdly.
- ni li tomo anu seme? - **ken** a! | - Does this count as a *tomo*? - **Maybe**!

eng: a period related to the Moon orbit
examples:
**tenpo mun** nanpa luka luka li tenpo mun monsuta. | The tenth **month** of the year is spooky season.
**mun** pi ante toki li pini. | Translation **Month** has ended.

eng: polar (in relation to the Northern hemisphere)
examples: **ma** Amelika **lete** | **North** America

eng: equatorial (in relation to the Southern hemisphere)
examples: mi lon ma Antasika li tawa **ma seli**. | I travel **north** from Antarctica.
mi sona **ala** e musi ni. | I am **not** aware of this game.
ona tu li sama **ala a**. | The two of them are **not at all** alike.
-- ike mi a. -- ike ala! **ale li pona**. | -- Oh, I'm sorry. -- **Not at all**.

eng: the same time as what was mentioned before
examples: mi ken ala toki tawa sina lon **tenpo ni**. | I cannot talk with you right **now**.
o lape lon **tenpo lon** a! | Go to bed right **now**!

waso li **lon** palisa kasi. | The bird is sitting **on** the tree branch.
mi tu li kama wan lon tenpo suno pini. | We got married yesterday.
soweli mi li **tawa** ilo mi. | My cat just sat **on** the keyboard.
suno li **open**. | The lights are **on**.
ona li toki **sike** e akesi. | They rambled **on and on** about lizards.
**noka** anu soweli anu ilo la sina tawa ma Sikako **kepeken** seme? | Did you go to Chicago **on foot**, by horse, or by car?
mi weka e selo **kili** li moku e insa. | I peel the **orange** and eat it.

eng: colour similar to red or yellow
examples: suno li weka lon tenpo kama poka li kama **loje**. | The setting sun has turned an **orange** hue.

eng: colour distinct from red and yellow
examples: ma Netelan la **loje jelo** li kule suli. | The colour **orange** has cultural significance for the Netherlands.
mi o kama sin tawa pali mi pi **tenpo pini**. | I should return to my **past** efforts.
sona pi **tenpo weka** li kama sin lon lawa mi. | I have remembered something from the remote **past**.
ona li **ken** wile e len sin. | They **probably** want new clothes.
mi **wile sona** e ijo mute. | I have a lot of **questions**.
jan pi soweli tomo o kepeken **supa monsi** ni. | People with dogs should use this **seat**.
ale o kama pona lon **tenpo kama poka**. | May everything get better **soon**.
**tenpo lili kama** la, jan olin sina li lon poka sina! | **Soon** your partner will be with you!
**mun** li suno wawa lon tenpo ni. | **The stars** are bright tonight.
ilo li pana e suno loje la o **kama tawa ala**. | If the traffic light is red, **stop**.
telo sewi li **pini**. | The rain **stopped**.
tomo ni awen li wile e supa sewi. | This bus stop needs a roof.
mi o pana e **toki**. | Let me tell you a **story**.

pali ni li wile e **tenpo** suli. | This job requires a long **time**.
**tenpo** seme la sina ken kama? | At what **time** can you come?
jan **tu** li lon tomo ni. | **Two** people are in that building.
kala ni li suli **mute**. | The whale is a **very** large animal.
mi esun **a** e tomo! | I bought my **very** own house!
nena li **lon seme**? | **Where** is the button?
tomo telo ni li **tawa ma seme**? | **Where** is this ship headed off to?
sewi li laso **tan seme**? | **Why** is the sky blue?
mi sona ala e **tan**. | I don't know **why**.
o moku **kepeken** ilo. | Please eat **with** a fork.
mi musi **lon poka** pi jan lili. | I'm playing **with** a kid.
mi **en** jan Kesi li poka pona. | I am friends **with** Katie.
jan pali pi **ma ale** o wan! | Workers of the **world**, unite!
**ale** pi sona mi li kama pini. | It's the end of the **world** as we know it.
mi **toki** tawa ona lon tenpo mute. | I've **written** to him often.
mi **sitelen** e nimi mi. | I **am writing** my name.
